history.content: In my eyes, CS61A doesn't teach you anything more than CS88 with respect to what you need in CS61B, considering that the last part of 61A is Scheme. However, with respect to pacing/difficulty 61B is a lot more similar than 61A. I would recommend against taking CS61A. Additionally, I liked CS61BL over the summer a lot due to the smaller class size which helped a lot since it might be a little easier to get help in addition to the more hands-on format.

children.subject: CS61B/BL is more in-depth as in that for projects, for example, you will be writing a lot of the code + tests on your own. Topics will be more in-depth and abstract more so than the formerly mentioned classes. The only thing to consider is that if you end up taking it over the summer, remember that you are taking an already fast-paced class during the normal semester, over the summer (aka in half of the time).
Thanks! That helped a lot! Is CS61B very different from cs61A/CS88?

history.content:
Hello, I am writing the post to get any advice on taking CS61A this Summer or just CS61B this Summer or Fall 2020. I was originally thinking of data science as a major so I took data8+ cs88(Spring 2020) but I just decided to change my major into cs, and I have to take cs47a to satisfy cs61a requirement. I am not sure just taking cs61B after cs88 would be fine without taking cs61a, considering that I should get minimum gpa 3.3 for cs prerequisites(in my case, grades will be counted only from cs61b and cs70 if I don’t take 61A). Moreover, I didn’t take the final for cs88 since I took it with pnp due to covid situation, and I don’t think I fully understood  the materials and concepts. Does cs61b assume you to be comfortable with the concepts from cs61a? Is it a bad idea to take 61B right after cs88? 

Thank you very much in advance.
history.subject: CS 61B after CS 88
